is a city in the northeastern

Even with measurements of only 38 square kilometers, Pordenone seems larger than it really is and packs in over 50,000 residents.  The primary interest in Pordenone by Americans is due to the city's close proximity to Aviano Air Base and Pordenone's more numerous bars, restaurants, hotels, shops, and attractions than in the town of Aviano.

value: content=Built in a mix of Romanesque and Gothic styles, and has additions from later centuries.

content=Moderately cheap restaurant. Serves great lunch and dinner menu items. Be sure to try the "Penne Carbonara" or the "Pizza Carbonara" (a cheese pizza with different cheeses, white Italian sauce, bacon, and a sunnyside up egg in the middle". Sounds a bit weird, but definitely worth the try. A whole pie is usually sufficient for one person as it is very thin.) The staff is extremely friendly and they all speak English.
content=Close to Aviano Air Base. Serves great lasagna and penne carbonara. Fairly cheap prices and usually frequented by Air Force soldiers. Open late hours.

content=Lovely cafe that serves, among otheres, a great double-shot americano coffee, matcha latte, very tasty sandwiches, cesar salads and delicious cakes. Free WI-FI and extremely friendly staff who can take care of customers' needs in English as well.
address=Piazza Mazzini , 41 Loc. Ghirano di Prata  - 33080  - Prata Di Pordenone  - PN
content=3 star hotel in ancient villa with wine cellars, located few kilometers away from Pordenone city center."
